title: Dark minimal split-layout portfolio with rotating vinyl + audio and glassmorphism overlays

requirements.text: Create a single-page dark, minimal, experimental portfolio UI with a full-screen background image named "bg.png" that is visually dimmed (reduced brightness) and uses white typography throughout.

quotes: The site should use a full-screen background image (bg.png) with reduced brightness and white typography.

acceptanceCriteria: The background covers the full viewport without tiling or stretching artifacts (uses a cover-style treatment).
A dimming treatment is applied so foreground white text is readable.
All primary text renders in white or near-white and maintains sufficient contrast against the dimmed background.

requirements.text: Implement a horizontally split layout using Flexbox: left column for title/tagline/categories, right column for the vinyl UI. Ensure elements are aligned, non-overlapping, and responsive (including small screens).

quotes: The layout must be horizontally split using Flexbox, with a left column containing the site title… and… category options… The right column should feature a large vinyl record image…
All elements must be properly aligned, non-overlapping, responsive…

acceptanceCriteria: On desktop widths, content is displayed as two side-by-side columns (left and right) using Flexbox.
On narrow/mobile widths, the layout adapts to avoid overlap (e.g., columns stack and remain usable).
No interactive element is clipped off-screen at common viewport sizes (mobile and desktop).

requirements.text: Render the left column content with: (1) site title text exactly "shibhi.studio"; (2) a cursive italic tagline exactly "Not just for a television, Teleport to where it’s written."; (3) a vertical list of interactive categories: Photography, Blender & Animations, Design, Electronics.

quotes: left column containing the site title “shibhi.studio”, a cursive italic tagline reading “Not just for a television, Teleport to where it’s written.”, and a vertical list of fully interactive category options such as Photography, Blender & Animations, Design, and Electronics.

acceptanceCriteria: The title text matches exactly: "shibhi.studio".
The tagline text matches exactly and is styled cursive and italic.
The categories appear as a vertical list with clear spacing and are clickable/tappable.

requirements.text: Add clear pointer/hover/active interaction affordances for category options and the play/pause button (e.g., cursor change, hover styling, focus styles). Ensure keyboard accessibility for opening/closing overlays and toggling play/pause.
acceptanceCriteria: Category items show a pointer cursor and visible hover styling on desktop.
Category items and the play/pause button have visible focus styles when navigated via keyboard.
Users can toggle play/pause using keyboard activation on the play/pause control.
Users can open a category overlay via keyboard activation on a category item.

requirements.text: Display a large vinyl record image named "vinyl.png" in the right column and implement smooth continuous rotation when audio is playing; rotation must pause when audio is paused.

quotes: The right column should feature a large vinyl record image (vinyl.png) that rotates smoothly.

acceptanceCriteria: The vinyl image is visibly large relative to the right column and remains fully visible without overlap.
When playback is active, the vinyl rotates smoothly (no stuttery frame-to-frame jumps).
When playback is paused, the vinyl stops rotating (or holds its current angle) and remains still.

requirements.text: Add a play/pause toggle button positioned at the center of the vinyl. When pressed, it must start/pause playback of an MP3 audio file and simultaneously control the vinyl rotation state.

quotes: A play/pause toggle button must be positioned at the center of the vinyl; when this middle button is pressed, it should start or pause playback of an MP3 audio file and simultaneously control the vinyl’s rotation.

acceptanceCriteria: The play/pause control is visually centered on top of the vinyl image.
Clicking/tapping the control starts audio playback and starts rotation.
Clicking/tapping again pauses audio playback and pauses rotation.
The control’s label/icon clearly reflects the current state (play vs pause).

requirements.text: Implement category overlays: clicking any category opens a small glass-morphism style overlay panel (transparent with blurred backdrop) that displays dynamically loaded content for that category.

quotes: Clicking any category option should open a small glass-morphism style overlay panel with a transparent, blurred appearance that displays dynamically loaded content.

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking a category opens an overlay panel above the main layout.
The overlay uses a glassmorphism look (semi-transparent background and visible backdrop blur).
Overlay content is loaded dynamically based on which category was clicked (not hardcoded to a single static block).
The overlay can be dismissed (e.g., close button and/or clicking outside and/or Escape key).

requirements.text: Ensure all static assets (bg.png, vinyl.png, and the MP3 file) are handled as frontend static files and referenced in a way that works when deployed under a non-root base path (e.g., GitHub Pages-style subpath hosting).

quotes: …intended to be hosted on GitHub and deployed via GitHub Pages…

acceptanceCriteria: The page loads bg.png and vinyl.png correctly in production builds without relying on absolute root-only paths.
The MP3 file is fetched and played successfully in production builds.
No broken asset links occur when the app is hosted under a subpath (not just domain root).

constraints: Use the existing React + TypeScript + Tailwind + React Query + shadcn/ui template; do not introduce a framework-free (vanilla-only) rewrite.
Do not edit any files under the immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT (compose existing UI components instead).
Do not add additional backend services; keep any needed data for category content in frontend-accessible sources (e.g., local structured data files).
nonGoals: Implementing actual GitHub Pages deployment workflows/actions (only ensure the built site works under subpath hosting constraints).
Adding third-party authentication, external databases, or real-time features.
Building a multi-page router-driven site unless required to meet the overlay/content behavior (keep it a single-page experience).
